### Claim Evaluation

To evaluate the claim, we will follow these steps:

1. Extract relevant information from the table.
2. Compare the viewer count of each episode with the specified conditions.

#### Step 1: Identify Relevant Information

| Episode Title | Row Index | Viewer Count |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Radio Heads | 34 | 3.70 |
| There Goes the Bride | 33 | 2.70 |

#### Step 2: Compare Viewer Counts

According to the claim, "the episode title radio head have 1 million viewer more than the episode title there go the bride".

- **Radio Heads** (Episode Title: Radio Heads) - Row Index: 34, Viewer Count: 3.70
- **There Goes the Bride** (Episode Title: There Goes the Bride) - Row Index: 33, Viewer Count: 2.70

To check if "Radio Heads" has 1 million more viewers than "There Goes the Bride", we need to calculate the difference:

3.70 (Radio Heads) - 2.70 (There Goes the Bride) = 1.00

Since 1.00 is not equal to 1,000,000, we can conclude that "the episode title radio head have 1 million viewer more than the episode title there go the bride" is **FALSE**.

### Final Answer
